intro: Phyllagathis subacaulis, commonly known as the slender phyllagathis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in opposite pairs along the stem. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
